subsection.name: How install Corsen on Mac OS X
subsection.p: Corsen works only with an Intel Macintosh and Mac OS X.4 (Tiger). With this operating system, you must install manualy jogl to use the 3D view. This limitation is due to a bug in Apple Java implementation. Corsen contain a hack to bypass this bug but force user to manually install JOGL.

ul.li:
Download the lastest version of JOGL for Mac Os X (Corsen is tested with 1.1) on
JOGL website .
Put the content of the lib folder to /Library/Java/Extensions

subsection.p: Warning: No tests have been done under Mac OS X.5 (Leopard) with Java 5.0 and Java 6.0.

If Corsen application still too unstable for you on Mac OS X, you can install Virtual box or other virtualization software and a linux distribution such ubuntu. We hope that next versions of Corsen will run perfectly under Mac OS X. Ready to use Virtualbox images for Ubuntu (and other OS) are available on VirtualBox Images website.

subsection.name: Corsen application under Linux
subsection.p: Corsen is only available for 32 bit Intel processor (i386) versions of linux. If you use OpenJDK/IcedTea version of the Java Runtime (see your distribution documentation to install it), the default Java Web Start on the main page may no work.
Use this specific Corsen application launch linkCorsen, to run Corsen (Don't use Sun script to check java version).
